{"step_by_step_thinking": "Preeclampsia is a pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and signs of damage to another organ system, often the liver and kidneys. It is known that the immune system plays a crucial role in pregnancy. The immune system needs to tolerate the semi-allogeneic fetus while still being able to respond to infections. Disruption of this delicate balance can lead to adverse pregnancy outcomes, including preeclampsia. Therefore, the disruption of immune regulation mechanisms is indeed associated with adverse pregnancy outcomes, including preeclampsia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
